intro: Boechera austromontana, commonly known as the Pacific rockcress, is a flowering plant native to western North America. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, which includes mustard and cabbage plants. This species typically grows in rocky or gravelly habitats, often in alpine or subalpine regions. It produces small, white or pale yellow flowers and has a mat-forming growth habit. The plant is characterized by its hairy leaves and is often found in areas with well-drained soils.
